configuration.stem: Complete the paragraph to summarize the central idea of the text.

feedBack.firstWrongHint: Which mode of reproduction is more advantageous for colonizing a large area quickly?
feedBack.finalWrongHint: The anemones that occupy the shallow reefs are likely the result of asexual reproduction, as they are hostile to genetically different individuals. The anemones that colonize new areas are usually the result of sexually-produced individuals that travel away from the parents.

configuration.paragraph:
Anemones that colonize shallow reefs are often the result of <<Option1>> reproduction. They form a dense group that extends across a large, rocky area. They are hostile to genetically different animals that try to colonize the area.
Anemones that colonize new areas are often the result of <<Option2>> reproduction. These animals feed on plankton in open water until they find a suitable location to anchor.
